quizData.question: It is an organized collection of structured information or data typically stored electronically in a computer system.
This is usually controlled by a Database Management system (DBMS).
It is an interface between the database and its end-users or programs, allowing users to retrieve, update, and manage how the information is organized and optimized.
It facilitates oversight and control of databases, enabling a variety of administrative operations such as performance monitoring, tuning, and backup and recovery.
It is a set of 1 or more computer programs that serves as an intermediary between the user and the DBMS.
It reads or modify database data by sending database queries to the DBMS.
These are unsophisticated users who interact with the system by using predefined UIs, such as web and mobile applications.
These are computer professionals who write application programs.
These interacts with the system without writing programs.
These form requests using a database query language.
It involves database design and construction on how the databases will operate and function within existing structures and location.
This type of database system involves a database that supports data located at a single site.
This type of database system involves a collection of multiple interconnected databases, spread physically across various locations.
This type of data structure is stored in relational databases and uses a predefined and expected format or schema.
This type of data structure in a DBMS exists in its original or raw state that can come in all shapes and sizes.
This type of data structure in a DBMS involves individual data items of the same type may have different sets of attributes and contains semantic tags and there is no pre-defined schema.
This type of DBMS is a computer language for storing, manipulating, and retrieving data stored in a relational database.
This type of DBMS is a new generation of DBMS that is not based on the traditional relational database model and has been developed to address the challenges represented by Big Data.
This type of DBMS features a dynamic schema for unstructured data and the data can be stored in different ways.
This type of DBMS allows you to create documents without first having to carefully plan and defined their structure.
This type of DBMS incorporates and builds on the concepts and principles of SQL and NoSQL systems.
This type of DBMS stores objects rather than data as individual relations.
This type of DBMS uses OOP languages such as C++, Java, and C#.
This type of DBMS is useful when you have a business need for high performance on complex data.
This type of DBMS is designed to facilitate the exchange of structured documents.
This type of DBMS simplifies data sharing between various systems because of its platform-independent nature.
This type of DBMS is useful as long as your datasets stay relatively small.
This SQL extension is a combination of SQL along with the procedural features of programming language.
This SQL extension is developed by Oracle Corporation.
This SQL extension adds and declare variables, support transaction control, error and exception handling, and row processing to SQLs existing functions.
This SQL extension is Microsoft and Sybase’s extension of SQL.
This SQL extension is an open-source object-relational database system that uses and extends the SQL language.
This SQL extension is an open-source relational DBMS developed and supported by Oracle.
This SQL extension is a relational DBMS contained in a C programming library.
This T-SQL statement block defines a set of SQL statements that execute together.
This T-SQL statement block assigns a variable in an SQL server.
This T-SQL statement block require you to have your variable names start at "@".
This T-SQL statement block assigns values to a variable.
This T-SQL statement block converts an expression of one data type to another.
This T-SQL statement block prints a pre-defined message or value.
This T-SQL statement block helps deal with any unexpected or exceptional situations that occur when a program/query is running.
This T-SQL statement specifies a block of code to be executed, if the returning condition is true.
This T-SQL statement specifies a block of code to be executed, if the returning condition is false.
This T-SQL statement specifies a new condition to test, if the previous returning condition is false.
This T-SQL statement loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is true.
This T-SQL statement is an extension of the IF-ELSE statement.
This T-SQL statement allows the user to apply multiple conditions to perform different sets of actions.
This is a specified a temporary named result set.
This is defined using the WITH operator.
This allows users to define tables that can be used in a particular query.
A Common Table Expression can be referenced within another SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement. (TR or FL)
Clauses like ORDER BY, INTO, and OPTION can be used in CTE queries. (TR or FL)
This type of CTE doesn’t use repeated procedural loops/recursion.
This type of CTE is easier to understand.
This type of CTE uses repeated procedural loops/recursion.
This type of CTE is useful when working with hierarchical data because the CTE continues to execute until the query returns the entire hierarchy.
It is a query (SELECT statement) inside another query.
The first query in a subquery is known as the outer query. (TR or FL)
The query inside a subquery is known as the inner query. (TR or FL)
The inner query of a subquery is executed last. (TR or FL)
The output of an inner query in a subquery is used as the input for the outer query. (TR or FL)
It is a virtual table that is constructed from other tables or views and saved as an object in the database.
It has no data of its own, but obtains data from tables or other views.
You can’t include ORDER BY clause and a reference to a temporary table or a table variable in a view. (TR or FL)
It is used to speed up searches/queries, resulting in high performance.
What factor to consider in creating an index states that creating an index to a particular column that is frequently searched can give performance benefits?
What factor to consider in creating an index states that putting an index on a relatively large table that contains a great number of rows can improve performance.
What factor to consider in creating an index states that a database that is frequently updated should have fewer indexes as it slows the performance of inserts, updates, and deletes.
What factor to consider in creating an index states that one must create an index only if necessary, as indexes takes up space within the database.
This type of index is based on only 1 column.
This type of index doesn't allow any duplicate values to be inserted into the table.
This type of index is based on 2 or more columns of a table.
This is a collection of operations that form a single logical unit of work.
It is the equivalent of a single SQL statement in an application program or transaction.
Which best exemplifies a database request?
quizData.answer: If a transaction has three update statements and one insert statement, the transaction uses four database requests.
choices: If a transaction has three update statements and one insert statement, the transaction uses four database requests.
The database will reject any entry in the gender column that is not "Male" or "Female," such as "Person.
This record or log helps bring the database back to a consistent state in the case of system failure.
If two people use the same ATM card at the same time, the first transaction will be processed, and the account will be locked to other users until the current session is complete.

quizData.answer: Transaction T1 requires all four SQL requests to be completed successfully, or the entire transaction will be aborted.
choices: Transaction T1 requires all four SQL requests to be completed successfully, or the entire transaction will be aborted.

quizData.question: It ensures that only valid data following all rules and constraints will be written in the database.

quizData.answer: When a transaction results in invalid data, the database reverts to its previous state.
choices: When a transaction results in invalid data, the database reverts to its previous state.
It ensures that once transaction changes are done and committed, they cannot be undone or lost.
The data used during the execution of a current transaction cannot be used by another transaction until the first one is completed.

quizData.question: It ensures that once transaction changes are done and committed, they cannot be undone or lost.
If the transaction fails between steps 3 and 6, the system must ensure that no updates are reflected in the database; otherwise, it will cause inconsistency.

The total balance of Aldous' and Brendon's accounts remains unchanged after the transaction. However, if another transaction accesses the partially updated database between steps 3 and 6, it will encounter an inconsistent state.
Transactions must run sequentially, meaning no other transaction will occur on either account until the current transaction is finished.
Once the user is notified that the transaction is complete, the updates made to the database must remain intact, even in the event of failures.
Which SQL Transactional command marks the beginning of transaction execution?
Which SQL Transactional command signals a successful end of the transaction so that any changes executed by the transaction can be safely committed to the database and will not be undone?
Which SQL Transactional command signals that the transaction has ended unsuccessfully so that any changes or effects that the transaction may have applied to the database must be undone?
Which SQL Transactional command allows you to roll the transaction back to a certain point without rolling back the entire transaction?
Which SQL Transactional command returns the number of BEGIN TRANSACTION statements that have occurred on the current connection?
Which transaction execution state allows a transaction to perform READ and WRITE operations?
In which transaction execution state has the final statement in queries been executed?
Which transaction execution state occurs after all operations have been completed?
Which transaction execution state occurs if one of the operations cannot be completed?
Which transaction execution state corresponds to the transaction leaving the system, whether it is committed or aborted?
Which of the following statements is TRUE  about concurrency control?
quizData.answer: When several transactions execute simultaneously in the database, there will be a chance that the consistency and integrity of data may no longer be preserved.
choices: When several transactions execute simultaneously in the database, there will be a chance that the consistency and integrity of data may no longer be preserved.
When a transaction results in invalid data, the database reverts to its previous state.
It ensures that once transaction changes are done and committed, they cannot be undone or lost.
The data used during the execution of a current transaction cannot be used by another transaction until the first one is completed.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about lost update?
quizData.answer: This occurs when two concurrent transactions, T1 and T2, are updating the same data element, and one of the updates is lost.
choices: This occurs when two concurrent transactions, T1 and T2, are updating the same data element, and one of the updates is lost.
This occurs when two transactions, T1 and T2, are executed concurrently, and T1 is rolled back after T2 has accessed its uncommitted data.
This occur when a transaction accesses data before and after one or more other transactions finish working with the same data.
It requires that all operations of a transaction should be completed.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about uncommitted data?
quizData.answer: This occurs when two transactions, T1 and T2, are executed concurrently, and T1 is rolled back after T2 has accessed its uncommitted data.
choices: This occurs when two concurrent transactions, T1 and T2, are updating the same data element, and one of the updates is lost.
This occurs when two transactions, T1 and T2, are executed concurrently, and T1 is rolled back after T2 has accessed its uncommitted data.
This occur when a transaction accesses data before and after one or more other transactions finish working with the same data.
It requires that all operations of a transaction should be completed.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about inconsistent retrievals?
quizData.answer: This occur when a transaction accesses data before and after one or more other transactions finish working with the same data.
choices: This occurs when two concurrent transactions, T1 and T2, are updating the same data element, and one of the updates is lost.
This occurs when two transactions, T1 and T2, are executed concurrently, and T1 is rolled back after T2 has accessed its uncommitted data.
This occur when a transaction accesses data before and after one or more other transactions finish working with the same data.
It requires that all operations of a transaction should be completed.

quizData.question: It guarantees exclusive use of data item to a current transaction.
Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about database-level lock?
quizData.answer: Prevents access to any row by transaction T2 while transaction T1 is using the table.
choices: Prevents access to any row by transaction T2 while transaction T1 is using the table.
Prevents the use of any tables in the database to transaction T2 while transaction T1 is being executed
This is good for batch processes but unsuitable for multiuser DBMS, as it can slow down data access by requiring thousands of transactions to wait for the current one to finish.

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about table-level lock?
choices: If a transaction requires access to several tables, each table may be locked
Two transactions can access the same database as long as they access different tables.
Transactions T1 and T2 cannot access the same table even when they try to use different rows.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about row-level lock?
quizData.answer: Allows concurrent transactions to access different rows of the same table even when the rows are located on the same page.
choices: If a transaction requires access to several tables, each table may be locked
Two transactions can access the same database as long as they access different tables.
Transactions T1 and T2 cannot access the same table even when they try to use different rows.
Allows concurrent transactions to access different rows of the same table even when the rows are located on the same page.

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about binary lock?
quizData.answer: It exists when access is reserved specifically for the transaction that locked the object.
choices: Has only two states: locked (1) and unlocked (0)
User does not require to manually lock or unlock data items.
If an object such as a database, table, or row is locked by a transaction, no other transaction can use that object
It exists when access is reserved specifically for the transaction that locked the object.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about shared/exclusive lock?
quizData.answer: This lock exists when a transaction wants to read data from the database, and no exclusive lock has held that data item.
choices: Has only two states: locked (1) and unlocked (0)
User does not require to manually lock or unlock data items.
If an object such as a database, table, or row is locked by a transaction, no other transaction can use that object
This lock exists when a transaction wants to read data from the database, and no exclusive lock has held that data item.

quizData.question: This occurs when two (2) transactions wait indefinitely for each other to unlock data.
Which of the following statements is TRUE  about deadlock prevention?
quizData.answer: A transaction requesting a new lock is aborted if there is a possibility of a deadlock. When a transaction is aborted, all changes it made are rolled back, and all locks it held are released.
choices: The DBMS periodically tests the database for deadlocks. If a deadlock is found, the “victim” transaction is aborted, and another transaction continues.
A transaction requesting a new lock is aborted if there is a possibility of a deadlock. When a transaction is aborted, all changes it made are rolled back, and all locks it held are released.
The transaction must obtain all the locks it needs before it can be executed. However, the serial lock assignment required in deadlock avoidance increases action response time.
Cause sometimes I look in her eyes And that's where I find a glimpse of us. And I try to fall for her touch But I'm thinking of the way it was.

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about deadlock detection?
quizData.answer: The DBMS periodically tests the database for deadlocks. If a deadlock is found, the “victim” transaction is aborted, and another transaction continues.
choices: The DBMS periodically tests the database for deadlocks. If a deadlock is found, the “victim” transaction is aborted, and another transaction continues.
A transaction requesting a new lock is aborted if there is a possibility of a deadlock. When a transaction is aborted, all changes it made are rolled back, and all locks it held are released.
The transaction must obtain all the locks it needs before it can be executed. However, the serial lock assignment required in deadlock avoidance increases action response time.

quizData.answer: The transaction must obtain all the locks it needs before it can be executed. However, the serial lock assignment required in deadlock avoidance increases action response time.
choices: The DBMS periodically tests the database for deadlocks. If a deadlock is found, the “victim” transaction is aborted, and another transaction continues.
A transaction requesting a new lock is aborted if there is a possibility of a deadlock. When a transaction is aborted, all changes it made are rolled back, and all locks it held are released.
The transaction must obtain all the locks it needs before it can be executed. However, the serial lock assignment required in deadlock avoidance increases action response time.

quizData.question: Described by the type of “reads” that a transaction allows or not.
It is a transaction can read data that is not committed yet.
It a transaction reads a given row at time T1, and then it reads the same row at time T2, yielding different results.
It a transaction executes a query at time T1, and then it runs the same query at time T2, yielding additional rows that satisfy the query.
Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about READ UNCOMMITED?
quizData.answer: Default isolation level for SQL Server
choices: It is the least restrictive isolation level
It ignores locks placed by other transactions
Can read modified data values that have not yet been committed by other transactions; these are called "dirty" reads
Default isolation level for SQL Server

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about READ COMMITED?
quizData.answer: It is the least restrictive isolation level
choices: Default isolation level for SQL Server
It is the least restrictive isolation level
Prevents dirty reads by specifying that statements cannot read data values that have been modified but not yet committed by other transactions
Other transactions can modify, insert, or delete data between individual statements in a current transaction, leading to non-repeatable reads or "phantom" data

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about REPEATABLE READ?
quizData.answer: Prevents dirty reads by specifying that statements cannot read data values that have been modified but not yet committed by other transactions
choices: A more restrictive isolation level than READ COMMITTED
Ensures that no other transactions can modify or delete data that has been read by the current transaction until the current transaction commits
Prevents dirty reads by specifying that statements cannot read data values that have been modified but not yet committed by other transactions

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about SERIALIZABLE isolation?
quizData.answer: Most restrictive level and gives solution to the phantom read. problem.
choices: Most restrictive level and gives solution to the phantom read. problem.
A more restrictive isolation level than READ COMMITTED
Ensures that no other transactions can modify or delete data that has been read by the current transaction until the current transaction commits

quizData.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE  about SERIALIZABLE isolation?
quizData.answer: Ensures that the data that one transaction has read, will be prevented from being updated or deleted by any other transaction
choices: Ensures that the data that one transaction has read, will be prevented from being updated or deleted by any other transaction
A more restrictive isolation level than READ COMMITTED
Ensures that no other transactions can modify or delete data that has been read by the current transaction until the current transaction commits

centralizes and consolidates large amounts of data from multiple sources

can be considered an organization’s 'single source of truth'
intended to perform queries and analysis

quizData.answer: Corporate users generally cannot work with databases directly.
choices: This helps users produce corporate reports for analysis, which can include spreadsheets, calculations, or interactive visuals.
When built-in graphical and analytical tools don't meet an organization's needs, custom reports are created using these tools.
Corporate users generally cannot work with databases directly.
These allow users to analyze the data using elaborate and complex multi-dimensional views.

quizData.question: This is the process of finding meaningful correlations, patterns, and trends in large datasets, with data mining tools automating the process.
These allow users to analyze the data using elaborate and complex multi-dimensional views.

Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about benefits of a data warehouse?
quizData.answer: Allows organizations to derive valuable business insights from their data to improve decision-making
choices: This allows business users to quickly access critical data from various sources in one place, saving time by avoiding the need to retrieve data from multiple sources
This provides consistent information on various cross-functional activities and supports ad-hoc reporting and queries
Helps to integrate many sources of data to reduce stress on the production system

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about benefits of a data warehouse?
quizData.answer: This optimizes for data retrieval, not for transaction processing
choices: Helps to reduce total turnaround time for analysis and reporting

This generates subtotals for all combinations of grouping columns specified in the GROUP BY clause.
This allows you to create a cross-tabulation, enabling you to aggregate results and rotate rows into columns.

This refers analyzing large amounts of data in a data warehouse or other sources to uncover hidden trends, patterns, and relationships and helps explain the past and predict future outcomes for analysis.

This step will collect the entire data and populate the data in the tool.
This step involves selecting the appropriate data, cleaning, constructing attributes from data, integrating data from multiple databases.

Selection of the data mining technique such as decision-tree, generate test design for evaluating the selected model, building models from the dataset, and assessing the built model with experts to discuss the result is done in this step
This step determines how well the resulting model meets business requirements and is reviewed for any errors or steps that need to be repeated.
Which of the following is NOT a valid statement about Deployment in Data Mining Implementation Process?
quizData.answer: This step will collect the entire data and populate the data in the tool
choices: The strategy to monitor and maintain the data mining model results to check for its usefulness is formed
Final reports are made, and a review of the whole process is done to check any mistake and see if any step is repeated
This step will collect the entire data and populate the data in the tool

quizData.question: Which Data Mining Technique is used to retrieve important and relevant information about data and metadata?

Which Data Mining Technique is used to combine various data mining techniques, such as trends, sequential patterns, clustering, and classification, while analyzing past events or instances in the correct sequence?

quizData.answer: Provides historical data for reporting and planning

Facilitates automated prediction of trends and behaviors as well as the automated discovery of hidden patterns
Provides historical data for reporting and planning

What is the delivery of different services through the Internet?
These resources include tools and applications like data storage, servers, databases, networking, and software.
Rather than keeping files on a proprietary hard drive or local storage device, cloud-based storage makes it possible to save them to a remote database.
As long as an electronic device has access to the web, it has access to the data and the software programs to run it.
This is defined according to where the infrastructure for the deployment resides and who has control over that infrastructure.
There are three types of cloud deployments categorized based on an organization’s ability to manage and secure assets as well as business needs.
This type of cloud infrastructure is built by a third-party organization to sell cloud services to the general public.
This is the most common type of cloud implementation; examples include Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Application Engine, and Microsoft Azure.
In this model, cloud consumers share resources with other consumers transparently.
Despite high reliability, lower costs, zero maintenance, and on-demand scalability, this is not suitable for organizations operating with sensitive information
This type of internal cloud is built by an organization for the sole purpose of servicing its own needs.
This is often used by large, geographically dispersed organizations to add agility and flexibility to internal IT services
The cloud infrastructure could be managed by internal IT staff or an external third party
This is the combination of a private and public cloud, providing for more flexibility to businesses
This cloud architecture enables companies to take advantage of the public cloud as and when necessary due to their easy workload migration

In this implementation type, businesses can use the public cloud for running high-volume applications like emails and utilize private clouds for sensitive assets like financials, data recovery, and during scheduled maintenance and rise in demand.
Which is not a Cloud Implementation type?
These come in different shapes and forms; no single type of service works for all consumers.
These often follow an à la carte model; consumers can choose multiple service options according to their individual needs
These services can build on top of each other to provide sophisticated solutions
The cloud service provider offers turnkey applications that run in the cloud.
Consumers can run the provider’s applications internally in their organizations via the web or any mobile device.
The consumer can customize certain aspects of the application but cannot make changes to the application itself.
The application is actually shared among users from multiple organizations.
Examples of this Cloud Service include MS Office 365, Google Docs, Intuit’s TurboTax Online, and SCALA digital signage.
The cloud service provider offers the capability to build and deploy consumer-created applications using the provider’s cloud infrastructure.
In this scenario, the consumer can build, deploy, and manage applications using the provider’s cloud tools, languages, and interfaces.
The consumer does not manage the underlying cloud infrastructure.
Examples of this Cloud Service include the Microsoft Azure platform with .NET and Java.

In this case, the cloud service provider offers consumers the ability to provision their own resources on demand; these resources include storage, servers, databases, processing units, and even a complete virtualized desktop.
The consumer then can add or remove the resources as needed.
Examples of this Cloud Service include a consumer can use Amazon Web Services (AWS) and provision a server computer that runs Linux and Apache Web server using 16 GB of RAM and 160 GB of storage.
Cloud computing enables immediate scalability of infrastructure capacity depending on the business need.
It is like having an unlimited IT resource, which can be scaled up and/ or down to meet user demands
A lot of factors have enabled globalization, and a key one is a technology and high-speed internet connectivity.
Cloud empowers enterprises to deploy their applications across the globe so they can service their customers at a fraction of the cost of traditional brick-and-motor businesses.
Due to lower latency, customers around the world get an identical digital experience while using the applications
Which cloud computing benefit enables immediate scalability of infrastructure capacity?
Which benefit allows enterprises to deploy their applications globally to serve customers?
What enables businesses to instantly scale their cloud capacity and access bandwidth demands?
What allows enterprises to focus on building their business rather than on idle infrastructure?
Which cloud benefit takes care of rolling out software and security updates automatically?

What reduces the risks of information loss and cyber threats using advanced features?
Which benefit significantly reduces power consumption and adverse environmental impact?
What offers businesses vast flexibility irrespective of device type or global location?
What improves teamwork using centralized documentation control and apps like Slack?
